alert.note: Alert for Hickory; Polk; St. Clair (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 16 at 7:24PM CDT by NWS Springfield
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT WESTERN HICKORY...NORTH CENTRAL POLK AND SOUTHEASTERN ST. CLAIR COUNTIES THROUGH 815 PM CDT... At 724 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Osceola, or 19 miles northeast of El Dorado Springs, moving southeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Locations impacted include... Pomme de Terre Lake, Pomme De Terre State Park, Osceola, Hermitage, Weaubleau, Wheatland, Collins, Flemington, Vista, Gerster, Quincy and Elkton. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
